Package net.sf.jgcs

Defines a generic interface for group communication.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Annotation
    Annotations provide optional semantic information to the protocol.
    BlockListener
    Application interface for delivering block notifcations.
    BlockSession
    Allows flushing the group after a block notification.
    ControlSession
    Allows a process to control its participation in a process group.
    DataSession
    Allows a process to multicast and deliver messages in a process group.
    ExceptionListener
    Application interface for delivering asynchronous exceptions.
    GroupConfiguration
    A process group identifier.
    Membership
    A group membership configuration.
    MembershipID
    Uniquely identifies each membership configuration.
    MembershipListener
    Application interface for delivering group membership change notifications.
    MembershipSession
    Allows the application to know the current group composition.
    Message
    This class defines a Message.
    MessageListener
    Application interface for delivering message payloads.
    Protocol
    A protocol instance is the main entry point for group communication.
    ProtocolFactory
    A protocol factory that can create instances of protocols.
    Service
    A service defines a delivery guarantee, such as reliability or order.
    ServiceListener
    Application interface for delivering service notifications.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ClosedProtocolException
    Thrown when trying to use a closed protocol.
    ClosedSessionException
    Thrown when trying to use a closed session.
    GroupException
    Thrown when there is an exception with group communication.
    InvalidStateException
    Thrown when an operation cannot be performed in the current group state.

Package net.sf.jgcs Description

Defines a generic interface for group communication. It is composed by a protocol that represents the toolkit that implements the interface, a GroupConfiguration that represents a configuration that is toolkit specific, and a pair of control and data sessions. The control session defines what can be done and notified to manage a group. The data session defines interfaces to send and receive messages.

Membership notifications are full member views that ensure that all the members that belong to this view in a certain time are alive and can receive messages. The Flush functionality ensures that if a member belongs to a view V, it receives all messages that are sent on view V, unless it does not belong to the next view (it means that the member died). Using the flush functionality, all members receive a block notification. Upon this notification, all members should flush pending messages and notify the end of the flush with a blockOk. After this notification, all alive members will receive a new view.

This interface can be used in partitionable systems or with a system that use the primary-partition approach. In this case, a member that does not belong to a primary partition can not receive any view until it is reintegrated again in the primary partition. If there are intermediate views, the member should be removed from the group and rejoin later.
